subject: RE: [junit] Swing Testing
msgSnippet: On way is to create a MockActionListener and have it so that when it recieves the event is sets some type of a flag: public class MockActionListener implements
messageBody:
On way is to create a MockActionListener and have it so that when it
recieves the event is sets some type of a flag:

public class MockActionListener implements ActionListener
{
private boolean receivedEvent = false ;

public void actionPerformed( ActionEvent e )
{
receivedEvent = true;
}

boolean hasEventBeenRecieved()
{
return receivedEvent ;
}
}

From there just register your object and do whatever the action is and test
if the event was recieved:

assertTrue( mockListener.hasEventBeenRecieved() );

You could also just do the same with an anonymous class, but a bit more
reusable with the MockActionListener.

Hope this helps.

Nathan
